title: 12/4/23 Joint Study Committee on Service Delivery Strategy
summary:
Overview:
This session of the Georgia Joint Study Committee on Service Delivery Strategy focused on finalizing recommendations for the committee's report. The discussion centered around reaching consensus on the draft recommendations, with input from the Association County Commissioners of Georgia (ACCG) and the Georgia Municipal Association (GMA).

Key Actions:
No bills were passed or referred during this session.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
No new bills were introduced.

Notable Moments:
- The committee discussed the need to wrap up the recommendations and provide a final report to the Lieutenant Governor and Speaker by the December 31st deadline. 
- There was discussion around reaching consensus on the six draft recommendations, with the suggestion to have ACCG and GMA provide their official positions on each recommendation.
- Commissioner Dockery and Mayor Ward summarized their written recommendations to the committee.

Votes:
No recorded votes took place.

Attendance:
A quorum was present, though the transcript did not provide specifics on attendance.

Adjournment:
The session was expected to wrap up within an hour. The committee planned to reconvene with ACCG and GMA to finalize the recommendations before the December 31st deadline.
